uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.swing

Class SwingFormComponentListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.swing.SwingFormComponentListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class SwingFormComponentListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ComponentListener
    class to map Fields to SwingFields and handle events. This also performs the default mapping of Forms to panels.
    Author:
    spb

      • getPanel

        public javax.swing.JPanel getPanel(java.lang.Iterable<Field> form,
                          boolean validate)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Get a JPanel containing the filled editing controls for this form. Note that this code assumes that only a single Panel is in existance at a time and while the panel is in use no other edits are made to the Form other than through the Panel
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        form -
        validate - boolean should the form be validated to show errors in initial state
        Returns:
        JPanel

                 throws ValidateException
        Validate a form (Including updating SwingField errors)
        Throws:
        ValidateException
        Parameters:
        form -
        Returns:
        boolean false if SwingFields fail to validate

      • getChooser

      • makeCompactGrid

        public static void makeCompactGrid(java.awt.Container parent,
                   int rows,
                   int cols,
                   int initialX,
                   int initialY,
                   int xPad,
                   int yPad)
        Aligns the first rows * cols components of parent in a grid. Each component in a column is as wide as the maximum preferred width of the components in that column; height is similarly determined for each row. The parent is made just big enough to fit them all.
        Parameters:
        parent -
        rows - number of rows
        cols - number of columns
        initialX - x location to start the grid at
        initialY - y location to start the grid at
        xPad - x padding between cells
        yPad - y padding between cells
